items.section: ## 9. Main Convergence Theorems and Physical Interpretation
items.raw_directive:
2131: The Wasserstein-Fisher-Rao (WFR) metric is a natural geometric framework for analyzing the convergence of probability distributions evolving under reaction-diffusion dynamics. We now state a formal conjecture regarding WFR convergence for the adaptive system.
2132: 
2133: :::{prf:conjecture} Convergence in the WFR Metric
2134: :label: conj-wfr-convergence
2135: 
2136: The composition of the kinetic evolution $\Psi_{\text{kin,adapt}}$ and the cloning selection $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ is a contraction in the Wasserstein-Fisher-Rao (WFR) metric. Consequently, the empirical distribution converges in WFR distance:

2139: \text{WFR}(\mu_t, \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \le C_{\text{WFR}} e^{-\lambda_{\text{WFR}} t}
2140: $$
